article.description: Monmouth, N.J. 62, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 56
article.headline: Monmouth, N.J. 62, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 56
article.linkText: Monmouth, N.J. 62, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 56
article.story: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J. (AP) -- John Bunch scored 23 points and pulled down 12 rebounds -- both career highs -- and also blocked four shots to lead Monmouth to a 62-56 win over Mount St. Mary's of Maryland on Saturday night. Dejan Delic added 21 points for Monmouth (7-8, 2-1 in Northeast Conference), which won its fifth straight game. Chris Vann led the Mountaineers (3-11, 2-1) with 13 points, while Kelly Beidler added 10 points and Jeremy Goode finished with nine points and four assists. The teams traded baskets for most of the first half, but several Monmouth turnovers helped the Mountaineers take a 29-25 lead at the break. Monmouth then appeared to take command midway through the second half and led by as much as eight points, but Mount St. Mary's wouldn't quit and cut the lead to 49-47 with 5:45 left. The Mountaineers would not get any closer, though, and Marques Alston's layup with three seconds left sealed the win for the Hawks, who hit nearly 48 percent of their shots but also committed 21 turnovers.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
